summary: The Improve Employer-Directed Skills Act amends the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act. It defines "employer-directed skills development" and provides an exception to interview requirements for individuals referred by employers for on-the-job training. It also allows employers to contract with local boards to provide skills development programs if they meet specific criteria, including program length, credentials, costs, and a commitment to employ participants. The bill replaces references to "customized training" with "employer-directed skills development."
